titles.title: O-VISA Act
Oversee Visa Integrity with Stakeholder Advisories Act
O-VISA Act
Oversee Visa Integrity with Stakeholder Advisories Act
O-VISA Act
Oversee Visa Integrity with Stakeholder Advisories Act

To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to allow labor organizations and management organizations to receive the results of visa petitions about which such organizations have submitted advisory opinions, and for other purposes.

To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to allow labor organizations and management organizations to receive the results of visa petitions about which such organizations have submitted advisory opinions.
Oversee Visa Integrity with Stakeholder Advisories Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Border Security.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 114-614.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 477.

action.text: Mrs. Walters, Mimi moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3636.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the House on June 10, 2016. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Oversee Visa Integrity with Stakeholder Advisories Act or the O-VISA Act
(Sec. 2) This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to require the Department of Homeland Security to give a copy of any decision regarding the nonimmigrant O-1 visa admission of an alien seeking to work in a motion picture or television production (or an accompanying O-2 visa alien involved in such production) to the labor union and management organizations that have provided advisory opinions with respect to such admission.
